itemDescription: Poet, lecturer, in Britain and Australia (1921-1965)

wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Henry "Harri" Jones (21 December 1921 – 29 January 1965) was a Welsh poet and university lecturer in Britain and Australia. Born in Wales, he wrote in English.

response: * Thomas Henry Jones, known as T. Harri Jones (1921–1965), poet in Britain and Australia
*29 January – T. Harri Jones, poet and academic, 43 (suicide)
*T. Harri Jones – The Enemy in the Heart
| T. Harri Jones||1921–1965||poet and lecturer||migrated to Australia||born in Wales
*21 December - T. Harri Jones, poet and academic (d. 1965)
The Anglo-Welsh poet T. Harri Jones was born at Cwm Crogau, in the parish Llanafan Fawr.

link_mentions.page: Harri Jones Memorial Prize for Poetry
response: The Harri Jones Memorial Prize for Poetry is an annual prize awarded by the University of Newcastle, Australia, to “an Australian poet, not yet 36 years of age, whose work in the field of poetry is judged to be outstanding”. The Prize is named for T. Harri Jones a former lecturer at the university.
*T. Harri Jones (1921–1965), Welsh poet and university lecturer
The Welsh poet and lecturer at the University of Newcastle T. Harri Jones drowned in the pool while swimming in January 1965.
* 29 January – T. Harri Jones, Welsh poet who emigrated to Australia
